dt-api.name: toJQuery()
dt-api.summary: Convert the API instance to a jQuery object, with the objects from the instance's result set in the jQuery result set.
dt-api.deprecated: Please note that as DataTables has no dependency on jQuery, as of v3, this method is now only relevant if you also load jQuery. Usage should be replaced with `-api toDom()` to create a `DataTable.Dom` object contains the nodes, or use standard DOM methods.

type.description: Create a jQuery object from an API instance.
type.returns: jQuery object which contains the values from the API instance's result set.

dt-api.description:
This method will create a jQuery object from the contents of the API instance's result set. This is primarily of use when working with the `nodes()` functions of the API such as `dt-api rows().nodes()`, `dt-api column().nodes()` and `dt-api cells().nodes()`, where it can be useful to easily convert the API instance into a jQuery object, working with the nodes using the chaining methods provided by jQuery.
Please note that `dt-api to$()` and `dt-api toJQuery()` are identical in functionality. Both methods are provided to cater for the two common forms of how jQuery is used.
